latest news.eng_title: Harris and Trump to Rally Supporters Ahead of US Presidential Election
latest news.summary: US presidential candidates Kamala Harris and Donald Trump will appear on Thursday to rally their main supporters. Harris will participate in a live stream with Oprah Winfrey, while Trump will attend a event with prominent Jewish donors before addressing the US-Israeli Council. Winfrey, a Harris supporter, will host a two-hour live stream in Michigan, 'Unite for America', highlighting the dozens of grassroots groups supporting Harris. Trump will speak at a nighttime event, 'Fighting antisemitism in the US', alongside Miriam Adelson, co-owner of the Dallas Mavericks and widow of casino magnate Sheldon Adelson. Trump will also address the US-Israeli Council, a non-profit organization supported by Sheldon Adelson and Haim Saban, a prominent donor to President Joe Biden and Democratic causes. The Council is holding its national convention in the weeks leading up to the first anniversary of Hamas' attacks on Israel on October 7, 2023, which sparked the war in Gaza. The 'Uncommitted' protest movement, which opposes the Biden administration's handling of the Israel-Hamas war, has announced it will not support Harris but urged its supporters to vote against Trump. The group, which received hundreds of thousands of votes in the Democratic primaries this year, has called for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza and an end to US arms shipments to Israel. 'Uncommitted' warned that some Democratic voters may stay home in November, particularly in states like Michigan. Harris' campaign team did not directly address the group's announcement, but stated that the candidate 'will continue to work towards ending the war in Gaza in a way that ensures Israel's security, the release of hostages, an end to suffering in Gaza, and the Palestinian people's right to dignity, security, freedom, and self-determination'.
latest news.title: Trump dice ser "mejor amigo" de judíos tras conocerse alegatos de que un aliado suyo es antisemita

latest news.eng_title: With Tim Walz on the Democratic ticket, Minnesota Republicans also hop on national wave
latest news.summary: Since Kamala Harris chose Tim Walz as her running mate, Minnesota Republicans have been given a national platform to criticize his leadership. Some, like House Majority Whip Tom Emmer, have pointed out flaws in his budgeting decisions and his response to crises, such as the COVID-19 pandemic and the riots following George Floyd's murder. Others, like U.S. Rep. Pete Stauber, have challenged Walz's military record. Democrats, on the other hand, have used the opportunity to highlight Walz's positive attributes and policy strides. Former Minnesota Senate Majority Leader Paul Gazelka has written a book about his experiences working with Walz, focusing on his leadership in crisis situations. Gazelka said, 'The No. 1 reason I'm focusing on the book and saying people shouldn't hire Tim Walz to be the VP candidate is he is a poor leader in crisis.' Meanwhile, some Republicans see the national attention as an opportunity to grow their political reputation and potentially run for governor in 2026.
latest news.title: With Tim Walz on the Democratic ticket, Minnesota Republicans also hop on national wave

latest news.eng_title: Vice Presidential Showdown: Walz vs. Vance
latest news.summary: Democrat Tim Walz and Republican JD Vance will face off in the only scheduled U.S. vice presidential debate on October 1 at 9 p.m. ET in New York City, hosted by CBS News. The 90-minute event will be moderated by Norah O'Donnell and Margaret Brennan. Walz, known for his 'regular guy' persona, aims to appeal to independent voters, while Vance, a U.S. senator from Ohio, is expected to employ a combative debating style. Both candidates seek to boost their ticket's standing ahead of the November 5 election.
latest news.title: Vice Presidential Showdown: Walz vs. Vance

latest news.eng_title: Gary Franks: Since 2009 Democrats have been dividing America, and the country wrestles with another assassination attempt
latest news.summary: Gary Franks, a former U.S. representative, argues that Democrats have been dividing America since 2009. He claims that their actions, such as passing the Affordable Care Act without bipartisan support and ending the filibuster for Supreme Court appointments, have led to the country's current divisions. Franks also criticizes Democrats for their rhetoric on bringing people together, citing their attempts to eliminate the filibuster and their history of divisive actions. He argues that the country's problems began when Democrat leaders, including Harry Reid and Mitch McConnell, took actions that prejudged and divided the nation. Franks concludes that Democrats' actions, rather than their words, have torn the country apart and that their claim to be able to bring people together is a 'farce.'
latest news.title: Gary Franks: Since 2009 Democrats have been dividing America, and the country wrestles with another assassination attempt

latest news.eng_title: Gillibrand offers to lead Senate Democrat campaign efforts
latest news.summary: Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand of New York has expressed interest in leading the Senate Democrats' campaign efforts for the 2026 election cycle. According to Gillibrand, her experience co-leading a campaign to flip congressional seats in New York is a motivating factor. If selected, she would focus on defending key Senate seats while targeting Republican-held districts in states like North Carolina and Maine. Gillibrand, heavily favored for re-election this November, is expected to play a pivotal role in the party's future strategy.
latest news.title: Gillibrand offers to lead Senate Democrat campaign efforts

latest news.summary: Sharon McMahon, an educator and author specializing in U.S. politics and government, discussed the upcoming US election with the author in a live video. McMahon, who writes for The Preamble on Substack and hosts the Here's Where it Gets Interesting podcast, aims to provide context and history to help viewers reach their own conclusions. Topics covered included the similarities between Kamala Harris and historical conservatives, and Donald Trump and progressives, as well as the importance of reading Substack instead of watching the news. The live video, which reached nearly 5,000 viewers, was a successful debut for live video on the platform, and more livestreams are scheduled for the coming days.
latest news.title: Can American politics be unbroken?

latest news.eng_title: Jean Smart to host 'SNL' for its 50th season premiere. See the other hosts, musical guests announced
latest news.summary: Saturday Night Live (SNL) is kicking off its 50th season on September 28 with host Jean Smart and musical guest Jelly Roll. The show has also announced several cast changes, with Maya Rudolph returning to revive her Vice President Kamala Harris impression ahead of the 2024 presidential election. Three cast members, Punkie Johnson, Molly Kearney, and Chloe Troast, have announced their exits from the show. New cast members Ashley Padilla, Emil Wakim, and Jane Wickline have been added to the show. Rudolph has confirmed she will be donning the pants suits again to revive her impression of Vice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic candidate for president. 'It's going to be insane,' said cast member Mikey Day about the show's 50th anniversary celebration, which will culminate in a live primetime special on February 16, 2025.
latest news.title: Jean Smart to host 'SNL' for its 50th season premiere. See the other hosts, musical guests announced

latest news.eng_title: Gillibrand offers to take helm of Senate Democratic campaign arm next cycle
latest news.summary: Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D-NY) has offered to take over as the leader of the Senate Democratic campaign arm next cycle, citing her experience with the 'coordinated campaign' in New York. She has been a strong fundraiser and has helped raise money for Democratic House candidates in her state. Gillibrand plans to campaign on behalf of vulnerable Democratic incumbents, including Sens. Bob Casey (D-PA) and Sherrod Brown (D-OH). If she takes over the campaign arm, she would succeed Sen. Gary Peters (D-MI), who has been the chairman of the committee for the last two cycles and will be up for reelection in 2026. Peters has expressed reluctance to continue leading the committee, stating, 'Two cycles is enough... that probably wouldn't even work.'
latest news.title: Gillibrand offers to take helm of Senate Democratic campaign arm next cycle

latest news.eng_title: Bacon and Vargas join 2nd District debate on Nebraska Public Media
latest news.summary: U.S. Rep. Don Bacon (R-Neb.) and State Sen. Tony Vargas (D-Omaha) will participate in a debate on October 8, 2024, hosted by Nebraska Public Media and its media partners. The debate will air live at 8 p.m. and will be moderated by Aaron Sanderford, a political reporter for the Nebraska Examiner. The debate will focus on the candidates' differences on issues such as reproductive rights, national security, and healthcare. Bacon has framed himself as a conservative willing to invest in infrastructure spending, while Vargas has painted himself as a fiscally responsible Democrat who voted for tax cuts and property tax relief programs. The race is considered one of the closest federal contests in Nebraska, with recent polling showing the candidates neck and neck. Vargas' campaign has argued that he will benefit from the presidential year, while Bacon's campaign has pointed to his results from 2020, when he outpaced Trump in the district.
latest news.title: Bacon and Vargas join 2nd District debate on Nebraska Public Media

latest news.eng_title: Josh Hawley, Lucas Kunce agree to TV debate, set for week before Nov. 5 election
latest news.summary: Republican U.S. Sen. Josh Hawley and Democrat Lucas Kunce have agreed to a televised debate on October 31, hosted by Nexstar. The debate will air on Nexstar's television stations in St. Louis, Kansas City, Springfield, and Joplin. This is the first time the two candidates will meet on the debate stage, following their disagreement about debates at the State Fair in August. Hawley had not agreed to a forum hosted by the Missouri Press Association in Springfield, and no other events between the two candidates had been confirmed as of Wednesday.
latest news.title: Josh Hawley, Lucas Kunce agree to TV debate, set for week before Nov. 5 election

news knowledge.eng_title: 'DEBORAHCRATIC' PODCAST'S PRE-ELECTION MINI-SEASON HIGHLIGHTS CONVERSATIONS ON AMERICA'S UNPRECEDENTED POLITICAL CLIMATE
news knowledge.summary: The 'Deborahcratic' podcast, hosted by Deborah Drucker, is releasing a pre-election mini-season on September 18th. The mini-season will explore the 'strange and unprecedented nature of the current election campaign' with guests including Dean Phillips, a three-term Democratic Congressman from Minnesota. Drucker remarks, 'In a time marked by the attempted assassination of Trump, President Biden's withdrawal from the race, and the rise of the Harris campaign, we are truly navigating uncharted waters.' The podcast will feature discussions on critical topics, from religion to politics, and is available on Spotify, Apple, and Google.
news knowledge.title: 'DEBORAHCRATIC' PODCAST'S PRE-ELECTION MINI-SEASON HIGHLIGHTS CONVERSATIONS ON AMERICA'S UNPRECEDENTED POLITICAL CLIMATE

news knowledge.eng_title: Trump opens up on Project 2025, says Democrats know 'it has nothing to do with me'
news knowledge.summary: Donald Trump has denied any involvement with Project 2025, a conservative initiative aimed at promoting right-wing policies. During an interview on the Lex Fridman podcast, Trump said, 'I know nothing about it. And they know that too,' adding that Democrats also 'know that.' He explained that he has not read the project's contents because he disagrees with most of its ideas, stating, 'It's easier than saying, 'I read it, and, you know,' all of the things.' Trump emphasized that Project 2025 has 'nothing to do with me,' despite containing controversial initiatives such as a total ban on abortion and restricting LGBTQ+ rights. The former president's comments come after Democrats warned voters about the potential effects of a Republican administration under Trump's second term.
news knowledge.title: Trump opens up on Project 2025, says Democrats know 'it has nothing to do with me'

news knowledge.eng_title: Trump Talks Legal Weed On Lex Fridman Podcast: 'We Can Live With The Marijuana'
news knowledge.summary: Donald Trump appeared on the Lex Fridman Podcast, discussing his endorsement of Florida's cannabis initiative to legalize recreational marijuana. Trump praised medical marijuana, stating it has been 'absolutely amazing' for his friends and others. He emphasized the need for a clean and lawful marijuana program, with age restrictions and regulation. Trump contrasted Florida's approach with New York City's, saying it 'smells all marijuana-y' and needs a system with control. Trump also suggested a public smoking ban if marijuana is legalized in Florida, a proposal also made by his ally, state Sen. Joe Gruters. Trump expressed confidence that the initiative will pass, citing positive polling among Democrats and Republicans alike.
news knowledge.title: Trump Talks Legal Weed On Lex Fridman Podcast: 'We Can Live With The Marijuana'

news knowledge.eng_title: Five takeaways from Trump's Lex Fridman podcast interview
news knowledge.summary: Former President Donald Trump spoke with podcast host Lex Fridman in a wide-ranging conversation on topics including the 2020 election, his plans for the presidency, and his views on marijuana and UFOs. Trump reaffirmed his support for medical marijuana and said he would be open to releasing information on UFOs and financier Jeffrey Epstein's client list. He also admitted to losing the 2020 election by a 'whisker' but claimed it was a 'fraud' and that many people felt that way. Trump also eased up on his feud with podcaster Joe Rogan, praising Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and saying he would be open to going on Rogan's podcast. Trump argued that having Kamala Harris as his opponent is not Joe Biden's fault, saying 'they took it over' and that Harris had 'no votes' in the 2020 election.
news knowledge.title: Five takeaways from Trump's Lex Fridman podcast interview

news knowledge.eng_title: Donald Trump to appear on Lex Fridman podcast, latest in interviews with influencers
news knowledge.summary: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump is set to appear on the Lex Fridman podcast, which is known for its conversations about intelligence, consciousness, love, and power. This is the latest in a series of interviews with influencers, including a recent appearance on video game streamer Adin Ross's livestream and a live interview with Tesla CEO Elon Musk on X. Trump has also spoken with actor and comedian Theo Von on his podcast, discussing topics such as Von's drug and alcohol use. The Trump campaign confirmed the appearance with USA TODAY, while the Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris' campaign has also leaned on content creators and influencers to reach voters online.
news knowledge.title: Donald Trump to appear on Lex Fridman podcast, latest in interviews with influencers

news knowledge.eng_title: President Trump to Appear on Lex Fridman Podcast — Here's When
news knowledge.summary: President Trump will appear on the Lex Fridman podcast, with the episode set to be released on Tuesday, September 3rd at 1 PM EDT on Fridman's YouTube channel. This is according to Fridman, who announced the news on Twitter, saying 'This happened. Podcast out tomorrow (Tue) at 1pm EDT.' The interview was previously teased by Fridman, who said he would be sitting down with Trump 'soon.' Trump has recently become active on X, where he has 90 million followers, after being banned from Twitter in 2021.
news knowledge.title: President Trump to Appear on Lex Fridman Podcast — Here's When

news knowledge.eng_title: Joe Rogan Watches On as Donald Trump Joins Yet Another JRE Rival After Facing Podcasters Rejection
news knowledge.summary: Donald Trump has been making appearances on various podcasts, including Lex Fridman's, after being rejected by Joe Rogan's JRE podcast. Trump's recent activity on social media has led to him being a popular guest on podcasts, with his last appearance being on Theo Von's 'This Past Weekend' podcast. However, Joe Rogan has stated that he is not interested in having Trump on his podcast due to his employer, Dana White, being a supporter of the 45th US president. Despite this, Rogan's podcast remains at the top of the Spotify charts, and it is unclear if his stance on Trump will change. Trump's recent failed assassination attempt has made him an even more popular figure, and it is possible that this could lead to Rogan reconsidering his stance on the ex-POTUS. As Lex Fridman said, 'having a popular figure like Donald Trump is bound to boost any podcast, given the following he has, not just as a politician but also as an entertainer in the past.'
news knowledge.title: Joe Rogan Watches On as Donald Trump Joins Yet Another JRE Rival After Facing Podcasters Rejection

news knowledge.eng_title: Donald Trump to feature on podcast with Lex Fridman 'soon'
news knowledge.summary: Former U.S. president Donald Trump will be a guest on Lex Fridman's podcast 'soon,' according to Fridman. Trump, who has 90 million followers on X, has been active on the platform after being banned from Twitter in 2021. Fridman, who has 3.6 million followers on X and 4 million subscribers on YouTube, frequently interviews leaders and technologists and has expressed interest in AI, human sciences, and robotics. This will be Trump's second appearance on X, following a conversation with Elon Musk earlier this month that was cut short due to a platform outage, which Musk attributed to a cyber-attack.
news knowledge.title: Donald Trump to feature on podcast with Lex Fridman 'soon'

news knowledge.eng_title: Turned down Multiple Times, Donald Trump Lands on Joe Rogan's Friend's Podcast, Fans React
news knowledge.summary: Joe Rogan, a UFC commentator and podcaster, has been at the center of a controversy surrounding Donald Trump's potential appearance on his podcast, 'The Joe Rogan Experience'. Despite having the opportunity to interview Trump multiple times, Rogan has consistently declined, stating that he doesn't want to help Trump. However, a recent post by Autism Capital sparked fan curiosity, leading to speculation about why Rogan hasn't invited Trump onto his show. The situation took a turn when it was revealed that renowned scientist and podcaster Lex Fridman might interview Trump on his show instead. Fans are divided, with some expressing disappointment that Trump won't be appearing on Rogan's podcast, while others believe that Fridman is a better interviewer for Trump. One fan even suggested that Trump's absence might be due to his request for Rogan to visit his house, which Rogan deemed unacceptable for his podcast. Rogan has since clarified that he doesn't endorse presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr., after Trump took to social media to criticize him.
news knowledge.title: Turned down Multiple Times, Donald Trump Lands on Joe Rogan's Friend's Podcast, Fans React
